result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Edward Ashley

records.addlTxt: State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley appeared by video.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway appeared by video for James Edward Ashley.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 12-5-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley appeared by video.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway appeared by video for James Edward Ashley.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has discovery but is in need of an offer and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom. 
Victim makes a statement requesting to modify the no contact order to a non-violent contact order.  State objects. Court denied request to modify the no contact order to a non-violent contact order.  Court will allow third party contact for purposes of the child.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Mark Sheremeta   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Due to reasons stated on the record, court must recuse herself from the case. Case is re-assigned to Judge Havas, Br 10. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-27-2022
filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court with attorney Thomas Reed.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-21-2022, filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-24-2022, filed.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM021171  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/21/2022
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-27-2022, filed.

Court ordered no contact with Sparkle M.A.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James Edward Ashley in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant James Edward Ashley in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Edward Ashley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
